H0.text: Radio waves are the type of electromagnetic radiation whose strong source causes the breakdown of ozone into oxygen in the ozone layer, as described by the electromagnetic absorption spectrum of ozone.

H1.text: Microwaves are the strong source of electromagnetic radiation that causes the breakdown of ozone into oxygen in the ozone layer.

H2.text: Infrared light is the type of electromagnetic radiation that, when ozone is exposed to a strong source of it, causes the breakdown of ozone into oxygen in the ozone layer.

H3.text: Ultraviolet light is the type of electromagnetic radiation that, when ozone is exposed to a strong source, causes the breakdown of ozone into oxygen, producing oxygen in the ozone layer.

A4.text: These ozone molecules absorb UVB light, following which ozone splits into a molecule of O2 and an oxygen atom
